newsitem.title: USA: S3 unveils solution to 3D bandwidth jams.
newsitem.headline: S3 unveils solution to 3D bandwidth jams.

text.p: Chip maker S3 Inc announced it has developed a semiconductor solution to the common problem of inadequate bandwidth in getting 3-dimensional material from the Internet.
The product, "RIO", lets users store graphic and audio data found on Internet Web sites directly on their computer's hard drive rather than having to do a lengthy download through a modem, S3 said.
RIO stands for Redistributed Internet Objects. It is designed for software developers to use in writing 3D applications to improve end-users' 3D experience, S3 said.
